title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox reliever Jordan Hicks placed on 15-day injured list with a shoulder injury.
Hicks struggled in the Red Sox's 8-1 loss to the Cleveland Guardians, raising his ERA to 8.20.
Left-handed pitcher Chris Murphy is expected to join the Red Sox bullpen in Hicks's absence.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics face uncertainty for 2025-26 season after losing three starters and Jayson Tatum's injury.
Boston Celtics traded Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis to reduce luxury-tax penalties this offseason.
Derrick White emphasizes team adjustment to new dynamics and aims to motivate roster as underdogs.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police determined a report of a masked man approaching a child as unfounded after investigation.
The incident reportedly occurred Tuesday afternoon on Waldo Road when a man allegedly attempted to grab an 11-year-old boy's arm.
Police Chief Julie Flaherty stated there's insufficient evidence after reviewing surveillance and interviewing witnesses.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica charged with assault using a hatchet and a civil rights violation in Cambridge.
Freeman allegedly threatened pro-Palestinian protesters and struck Fawaz Abusharkh with an Audi car door.
Incident occurred during August 10 protest organized by Palestinian Youth Movement and Boston Coalition for Palestine.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie left tackle Will Campbell was a limited participant in practice due to an ankle injury.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez has not practiced since July due to a hamstring injury and may miss the season opener.
The Patriots face depth issues at left tackle with Vederian Lowe and Marcus Bryant as possible replacements.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive seaweed heterosiphonia japonica causes a strong rotten egg smell at Good Harbor Beach, Gloucester.
Strong winds from Hurricane Erin washed significant amounts of the seaweed ashore, where it's now decomposing.
The seaweed, first found off Rhode Island in 2008, spans from Nova Scotia to Long Island's south side.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An ATM exploded in Woburn from a suspected pipe bomb, prompting an FBI investigation.
The explosion occurred at Eastern Bank on Mishawaun Road during a tampering incident Thursday morning.
The suspect remains at large; police report no injuries and declare no current threats to public safety.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, of Canton, was arrested for the May murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester, Boston Police report.
Shakar Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street and later died at a hospital, police said.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearm violation; arraignment is expected in Roxbury Municipal Court.

title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: New England governors urge the Trump administration to uphold offshore wind permits and allow project constructions to proceed.
President Trump, during his second term, targets the offshore wind industry, citing unfounded harms to marine life.
Governors argue offshore wind supports American jobs and innovation, suing Trump over halted wind development efforts.

title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Kevin Doherty was shot and killed on August 28 in Shrewsbury after walking his son to school.
Suspect Snehal A. Srivastava allegedly shot Doherty while he reported graffiti on a bridge to the police.
The Shrewsbury community will hold a vigil and fundraiser for Doherty on October 11 at SAC Park.
